page.title: 07FARMING..AUCTION PRICES
page.content: A visit to Speedie Brothers Auctioneers in Cupar provided interesting information about farm prices for June 1985. Beef cattle were priced at 102 pence per kilo with a subsidy of 8.7 pence a kilo. The cattle are mainly Aberdeen Angus, Hereford, Freisian crossed with heavier European breeds such as Charolais and Simmental. Our interviewer was told that in the future the trend would be towards producing meat from these European breeds. It was also suggested that in the future the meat trade would be taken over by large multiple stores and that local butchers shops would become a thing of the past. Other prices at this week's auction included Â£135 for 3 week old bull calves and similar age Heifer calves fetching Â£100 a head.
